content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="/xsl/oairepository/oai2.xsl.v1.0" ?> <OAI-PMH xmlns="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/OAI-PMH.xsd"> <responseDate>2015-03-12T19:37:39Z</responseDate><request verb="ListRecords" set="user-osr" metadataPrefix="oai_dc">http://zenodo.org/oai2d</request><ListRecords> <record><header><identifier>oai:zenodo.org:7211</identifier><datestamp>2014-03-10T17:37:56Z</datestamp><setSpec>openaire</setSpec><setSpec>user-zenodo</setSpec><setSpec>user-osr</setSpec></header><metadata><oai_dc:dc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd">   <dc:creator>Herb, Ulrich</dc:creator>   <dc:title>Open Initiatives: Offenheit in der digitalen Welt und Wissenschaft</dc:title>   <dc:date>2012-05-03</dc:date>   <dc:subject>cc-by</dc:subject>   <dc:identifier>http://zenodo.org/record/7211</dc:identifier>   <dc:identifier>           doi:10.5281/zenodo.7211</dc:identifier>   <dc:description>Abstract in English language: Initiatives that are calling for transparency, open and easy access to information (of academic, administrative or any other origin) are  gaining momentum and are beginning to differentiate more and more. The claims range from Free Access to information to Open Access according to the principles of the Open Source community. Some initiatives focus more on transparency rather than on openness, such as the whistleblower platform Wikileaks, while others (e.g. Open Government and Open Access to Research Data) combine the demands for transparency and openness or focus on the provision of non-proprietary information (like the geodata project OpenStreetMap or Open Metrics concepts in the scientific area). Twelve authors from different Open Data projects and from the context of Open Access to scientific information, Open Science, journalism and law analyze the Open Initiatives and discuss their common limitations as well as radical concepts of Openness such as WikiLeaks and Anonymous.  Abstract in German language:    Initiativen, die Transparenz, offenen und m\ufffd\ufffdglichst einfachen Zugang zu Informationen, etwa in Wissenschaft und Verwaltung fordern und herstellen, gewinnen rasant an Bedeutung und beginnen sich immer weiter zu differenzieren. Die Forderungen reichen von freiem (im Sinne von kostenlosem) Zugang zu Informationen bis hin zu offenem Zugang analog den Prinzipien der Open Source Community. Manche Initiativen und Ph\ufffd\ufffdnomene fokussieren st\ufffd\ufffdrker auf Transparenz als auf Offenheit, wie z.B. die Whistleblower-Plattform Wikileaks, w\ufffd\ufffdhrend wiederum andere (z.B. Open Government oder Open Access zu Forschungsdaten) die Forderungen nach Transparenz und Offenheit kombinieren oder sich an der Bereitstellung nicht-propriet\ufffd\ufffdrer Informationen versuchen (wie das Geodaten-Projekt OpenStreetMap oder die Open Metrics Konzepte im Wissenschaftskontext). Zw\ufffd\ufffdlf Autorinnen und Autoren aus Open Data Projekten und aus den Bereichen Open Access, Open Science, Journalismus und Recht beschreiben und analysieren die besagten und andere Open Initiatives, diskutieren deren Gemeinsamkeiten und Grenzen sowie radikale Offenheitskonzepte wie WikiLeaks und Anonymous.</dc:description>   <dc:rights>         info:eu-repo/semantics/openAccess       </dc:rights>   <dc:type>       info:eu-repo/semantics/article     </dc:type> </oai_dc:dc> </metadata></record><record><header><identifier>oai:zenodo.org:7438</identifier><datestamp>2014-03-10T17:37:56Z</datestamp><setSpec>openaire</setSpec><setSpec>user-osr</setSpec><setSpec>user-zenodo</setSpec></header><metadata><oai_dc:dc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd">   <dc:creator>Herb, Ulrich</dc:creator>   <dc:title>Offenheit und wissenschaftliche Werke: Open Access, Open Review, Open Metrics, Open Science & Open Knowledge</dc:title>   <dc:date>2012-05-03</dc:date>   <dc:subject>cc-by</dc:subject>   <dc:identifier>http://zenodo.org/record/7438</dc:identifier>   <dc:identifier>           doi:10.5281/zenodo.7438</dc:identifier>   <dc:description><p>This article analyses the concepts of openness in several contexts as Open Access, Open Access to Research Data, Open Science, Open Review &amp; Open Metrics.</p>  <p>Im Beitrag werden verschiedene Konzepte von &quot;Offenheit&quot; - wie Open Access, Open Access to Research Data, Open Science, Open Review und Open Metrics - analysiert.</p></dc:description>   <dc:publisher/>   <dc:rights>         info:eu-repo/semantics/openAccess       </dc:rights>   <dc:type>       info:eu-repo/semantics/article     </dc:type> </oai_dc:dc> </metadata></record><record><header><identifier>oai:zenodo.org:7445</identifier><datestamp>2014-03-10T17:37:57Z</datestamp><setSpec>user-zenodo</setSpec><setSpec>openaire</setSpec><setSpec>user-osr</setSpec></header><metadata><oai_dc:dc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd">   <dc:creator>Beucke, Daniel</dc:creator>   <dc:creator>Herb, Ulrich</dc:creator>   <dc:title>Mindmap: Acceptance of AltMetrics</dc:title>   <dc:date>2013-06-20</dc:date>   <dc:subject>cc-by</dc:subject>   <dc:identifier>http://zenodo.org/record/7445</dc:identifier>   <dc:identifier>           doi:10.5281/zenodo.7445</dc:identifier>   <dc:description><p>This figure depicts the results of a&nbsp;breakout goup&#39;s discussion at the OAI8 conference in Geneva. It focuses on measures that are considered appropriate to improve the acceptance of Altmetrics or alternative impact metrics.</p></dc:description>   <dc:rights>         info:eu-repo/semantics/openAccess       </dc:rights>   <dc:type>       info:eu-repo/semantics/article     </dc:type> </oai_dc:dc> newspapers in German academic libraries and university libraries<br /> b) the expenditures for acquiring books (including dissertations), scientific journals, magazines and newspapers in German academic libraries and university libraries<br /> c) the total resources in German academic libraries and university libraries<br /> d) the inflation rates in Germany<br /> between the years 2007 and 2012.</p>  <p><br /> Please pay attention to the readme-file (in English or German Language) for more information.</p></dc:description>   <dc:rights>         info:eu-repo/semantics/openAccess
